blocks.value: Saint Andrew was the brother of Simon Peter and the first disciple called by Jesus. Originally a follower of John the Baptist, Andrew immediately recognized Jesus as the Messiah.

Andrew's first act after meeting Jesus was to bring his brother Peter to the Lord (John 1:40-42). He is known as a great evangelist who constantly brought others to Christ, including the boy with loaves and fishes.

Tradition holds that Andrew preached in Greece, Asia Minor, and Russia. He was martyred in Patras, Greece, on an X-shaped cross (now called St. Andrew's Cross), which he embraced as a blessing, spending two days preaching from it before his death.
